videosDetails.title: I See Something Blue | Colors Song for Children
videosDetails.description:
I See Something Blue is now available on the Super Simple Songs Volume 2 DVD! Get it on Amazon! http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongsVol2DVD...

This Super Simple colors song for kids introduces blue, yellow, red, and purple. ^_^ 

iTunes: http://bit.ly/ISeeSomethingBlue_iTunes
Amazon: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongs1_Amazon

******
Music & Lyrics: Copyright 2005, 2014 Super Simple Learning®
Video: Copyright 2014 Super Simple Learning®

******
"I See Something Blue" is a super simple, super fun colors song for kids.

Time for a family road trip! Playing the "I See Something Blue" game is a great way to pass the time and talk about all of the things you see around you. Look for blue, yellow, red, and purple objects with the family as they drive through the countryside.
 
Play the "I See Something Blue" game at home or in the classroom by looking around the room between verses to find and identify items in different colors.

Blue! I see something blue.

videosDetails.title: I See Something Pink | Colors Song | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
Brush Your Teeth song! ►►https://youtu.be/K26y_Ca9hoc

It's another super simple colors song from Super Simple Learning! "Pink, orange, brown, green... I see colors everywhere."

iTunes: http://bit.ly/ISeeSomethingPink_iTunes
Amazon: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongs1_Amazon

*****
Music & Lyrics: Copyright 2005, 2014 Super Simple Learning®
Video: Copyright 2014 Super Simple Learning®

******
Thank you very much for watching and sharing ^_^

We upload new videos every Wednesday! To make sure you get our latest, subscribe here: http://bit.ly/SSSYTsubscribe

*****
To turn this song into an activity, have children find objects around the room during the musical interludes, and then pause the video and talk about the different objects you found. For example, when the song says, "Find something pink!" look for pink objects around the room. Pause the video before the next verse so you can talk about what you found. "I found an eraser / a teddy bear / a t-shirt / etc." 

With the simple language in this song, you are ready to play an easy color recognition game in the classroom, in the car, on the train, at home, or while taking a walk. You can play anywhere!

*****
Subscribe to the Super Simple Songs channel for a mix of classic kids songs (ABC Song, BINGO, Ten In The Bed, Old McDonald, Rain Rain Go Away, Row Row Row Your Boat, Eensey Weensey Spider, Hickory Dickory Dock, etc.) and originals like "I See Something Blue" made SIMPLE for emerging speakers: http://bit.ly/SSSYTsubscribe

videosDetails.title: Ten In The Bed | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
Practice counting down from 10 to 1 with the classic kids' song, Ten In The Bed. Roll over, roll over!
DVD: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongsDVD_Amazon
iTunes: http://bit.ly/TenInTheBed_iTunes
Amazon: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongs1_Amazon
Google Play: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongs1_Googl...

******
Music: Traditional
Adapted Lyrics: Copyright 2005, 2014 Super Simple Learning®
Video: Copyright 2012 Super Simple Learning®

******
Thank you very much for watching and sharing ^_^

We upload a new video every Wednesday! To make sure you get our latest, subscribe here: http://bit.ly/SSSYTsubscribe

******
Counting down songs for children like 10 In The Bed are great for introducing the concept of subtraction, and the repetitive nature of the songs allows students to learn the songs really quickly. As the teddy bears fall from the bed, young learners can recalculate the number of teddy bears left each time. Also, take the opportunity to identify the animals in the window! 

For a great idea on how to use this song in the classroom, watch this video from Daddy Ross Preschool in Argentina: http://youtu.be/a2bxC_TovZ4 and our reply video: http://youtu.be/Rc6XV9sHv8I

This video was created as a thank you to everyone for helping us reach 100,000,000 views on YouTube.  Twinkle Twinkle Little Star had long been our most requested song, and we were really happy to record the song with one of our students, Nagi.

videosDetails.title: Little Snowflake | Kids Songs | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
Brush Your Teeth song! ►►https://youtu.be/K26y_Ca9hoc

Little Snowflake brings together the same team that created the Twinkle Twinkle Little Star video (http://youtu.be/yCjJyiqpAuU) to tell a short story of a snowman brought to life by the magic and beauty of snowfall. As he tries to ice skate, he learns the value of perseverance  and teamwork. Along the way, we get to learn and review parts of the body (head, nose, hand). We hope you love it! + More (50.20 minutos de Super Simple songs) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tF7YQKgj1yA 1 hour Christmas songs and more (Dream English) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X2B7UxeHYCo ENLACES PRIMER TRIMESTRE MUSIC - Musical instruments A continuación podemos ver unos enlaces de los instrumentos musicales en general, pero en concreto hemos trabajado los siguientes: - Drum - Violin - Piano - Bag instruments (manipular instrumentos de nuestra bolsa como los crótalos, pandereta, triángulo, maraca, claves, castañuelas, cascabeles, sonajas y rascador) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mkqxl8S_VEg https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KzgiJU5ueKU https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fKdFirIBLwo - Notas musicales: DO https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fYhj8vdp2Xk - Compositores y obras Bach "Jesús, la alegría de los hombres" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qI3CFEs8Mc0 Mozart "La sinfonía de los juguetes" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Q8kDqDsarY "Marcha turca" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e6M_JXRV2l0 Vivaldi Las cuatro estaciones: "Otoño" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rLJ9Ev41_sk Las cuatro estaciones: "Invierno" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HSJUdiZD1dw Tchaikowsky "El cascanueces" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eLyONiJZc84 "Danza china" (Fantasía de Walt Disney) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eW1sR-A6AA8 "Danza rusa" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L8jKNdNyyrI Strauss "Concierto de año nuevo" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L6qtZ4ecvYQ J. Brahms "Canción de cuna" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6g0PkHHb-sA Villancicos Jingle Bells We wish you a Merry Christmas - Otros conceptos trabajados: Quiet/ silence Music and noise Relaxation - Dibujos animados: Pocoyo´s band https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J-RFJj6XMuI Peppa Pig y los instrumentos de percusión https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YW06aLCQqfw Peppa Pig y los instrumentos musicales https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yRlI-hKRiRM PRIMER TRIMESTRE PLASTIC ARTS Antonio López. Rutinas de pensamiento sobre el cuadro "Sink and mirrow" Van Gogh. Rutinas de pensamiento sobre el cuadro "The bedroom" Gaudí. "Parque Güell" Trabajo artístico representando la salamandra del Parque Güell "Casa Battló" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DGnd0RxE6l8 Klimt. Rutina de pensamiento sobre el cuadro "El árbol de la vida" OTROS TRABAJOS: - Búhos con hojas del Otoño - Madre Cabrini - Christmas Card - Todas las fichas de Ludiletras sobre dibujo dirigido PÁGINAS WEB CABRINI PÁGINA WEB COLEGIO http://www.colegiocabrini.es/ BLOG ENGLISH CABRINI INFANT http://blogcabriniprimaria.weebly.com/infant TWITTER CABRINI https://twitter.com/colegiocabrini

videosDetails.title: The Hello Song For Children | Preschool, Kindergarten, Learn English
videosDetails.description:
The Hello Song is one of the most popular Dream English free song downloads get it here: http://www.dreamenglish.com/hellosong A great way to start any class, or day! 

Song by Matt. Video by Dream English. 

Teachers! You can also use the song to have the children hold hands and make a circle. Then do all of the action in a circle. 

Let's make a circle hand gesture inspired by the Sing and Sign with Lisa DVD. Check it out here: http://youtu.be/cjPHOuP3ot4

videosDetails.title: Bye Bye Goodbye | Goodbye Song for Kids | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
This super simple goodbye song is great for ending nursery school, preschool, and children's ESL/EFL classes. It's very easy to sing along with and learn through gestures, and it ends with 45 seconds of instrumental music to play as children leave the classroom. Together with our song "Hello Hello!" (which you can find here: https://youtu.be/fN1Cyr0ZK9M), you'll have a great start and finish to any class or play session.

videosDetails.description:
I See Something Blue is now available on the Super Simple Songs Volume 2 DVD! Get it on Amazon! http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongsVol2DVD...

******
Music & Lyrics: Copyright 2005, 2014 Super Simple Learning®
Video: Copyright 2014 Super Simple Learning®

******
"I See Something Blue" is a super simple, super fun colors song for kids.

Time for a family road trip! Playing the "I See Something Blue" game is a great way to pass the time and talk about all of the things you see around you. Look for blue, yellow, red, and purple objects with the family as they drive through the countryside.
 
Play the "I See Something Blue" game at home or in the classroom by looking around the room between verses to find and identify items in different colors.

Video: Copyright 2014 Super Simple Learning®

******
Thank you very much for watching and sharing ^_^

We upload new videos every Wednesday! To make sure you get our latest, subscribe here: http://bit.ly/SSSYTsubscribe

*****
To turn this song into an activity, have children find objects around the room during the musical interludes, and then pause the video and talk about the different objects you found. For example, when the song says, "Find something pink!" look for pink objects around the room. Pause the video before the next verse so you can talk about what you found. "I found an eraser / a teddy bear / a t-shirt / etc." 

With the simple language in this song, you are ready to play an easy color recognition game in the classroom, in the car, on the train, at home, or while taking a walk. You can play anywhere!

*****
Subscribe to the Super Simple Songs channel for a mix of classic kids songs (ABC Song, BINGO, Ten In The Bed, Old McDonald, Rain Rain Go Away, Row Row Row Your Boat, Eensey Weensey Spider, Hickory Dickory Dock, etc.) and originals like "I See Something Blue" made SIMPLE for emerging speakers: http://bit.ly/SSSYTsubscribe

videosDetails.title: Ten In The Bed | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
Practice counting down from 10 to 1 with the classic kids' song, Ten In The Bed. Roll over, roll over!
DVD: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongsDVD_Amazon
iTunes: http://bit.ly/TenInTheBed_iTunes
Amazon: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongs1_Amazon
Google Play: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongs1_Googl...

******
Music: Traditional
Adapted Lyrics: Copyright 2005, 2014 Super Simple Learning®
Video: Copyright 2012 Super Simple Learning®

******
Thank you very much for watching and sharing ^_^

We upload a new video every Wednesday! To make sure you get our latest, subscribe here: http://bit.ly/SSSYTsubscribe

******
Counting down songs for children like 10 In The Bed are great for introducing the concept of subtraction, and the repetitive nature of the songs allows students to learn the songs really quickly. As the teddy bears fall from the bed, young learners can recalculate the number of teddy bears left each time. Also, take the opportunity to identify the animals in the window! 

For a great idea on how to use this song in the classroom, watch this video from Daddy Ross Preschool in Argentina: http://youtu.be/a2bxC_TovZ4 and our reply video: http://youtu.be/Rc6XV9sHv8I

There were ten in the bed and the little one said, "Roll over, roll over."

So they all rolled over and one fell out.

Eight!

Six!

So they all rolled over and one fell out.

Five!

So they all rolled over and one fell out.

Four! 
There were four in the bed and the little one said, "Roll over, roll over."
So they all rolled over and one fell out.

Three! 

There were three in the bed and the little one said, "Roll over, roll over."

Two!

One! 

There was one in the bed and the little one said, "I'm lonely..."

videosDetails.title: Jingle Bells | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
Jingle Bells in now available on the Super Simple Songs - Christmas DVD! Get it on Amazon! bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongsChristmasDVD_Amazon

An easy-to-teach, easy-to-learn version of the children's Christmas song, Jingle Bells. 
iTunes: http://bit.ly/JingleBells_iTunes
Amazon: http://bit.ly/SuperSimpleSongsChristm...

******
Jingle Bells is a holiday favorite around the world. However, the lyrics to Jingle Bells can often be too fast for emerging speakers to sing-along with and understand. This version of Jingle Bells from the "Super Simple Songs - Christmas" CD, has a "Learn It" and "Sing It" verse. The first time through, kids can sing in a call-and-response format so it's easy to follow along. Then we sing one time through with no call-and-response so kids can try to sing at regular speed.

******

videosDetails.title: Little Snowflake | Kids Songs | Super Simple Songs
videosDetails.description:
Brush Your Teeth song! ►►https://youtu.be/K26y_Ca9hoc

Little Snowflake brings together the same team that created the Twinkle Twinkle Little Star video (http://youtu.be/yCjJyiqpAuU) to tell a short story of a snowman brought to life by the magic and beauty of snowfall. As he tries to ice skate, he learns the value of perseverance  and teamwork. Along the way, we get to learn and review parts of the body (head, nose, hand). We hope you love it! videosDetails.title: Marcha Turca - Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
Vivaldi-El Otoño-Las cuatro estaciones-Salzburger Kammerorchester
videosDetails.description:
Las cuatro estaciones es el título de un libro de cuatro conciertos para violín y orquesta (La primavera, El verano, El otoño y El invierno) del compositor italiano Antonio Vivaldi, incluido en Il cimento dell'armonia e dell'inventione, Op. 8. Se trata de una obra descriptiva que evoca, a través de elementos de lenguaje musical, distintos aspectos de las estaciones del año.
Concerto n.º 1 en mi mayor, Op. 8, RV 269, "La primavera" (Primavera) Allegro Largo Allegro Pastorale
Concerto n.º 2 en sol menor, Op. 8, RV 315, "L'estate" (Verano) Allegro non molto Adagio e piano - Presto Presto e forte
Concerto n.º 3 en fa mayor, Op. 8, RV 293, "L'autunno" (Otoño)
Allegro Adagio molto Allegro
Concerto n.º 4 en fa menor, Op. 8, RV 297, "L'inverno" (Invierno) Allegro non molto Largo Allegro

Otoño (Concierto nº 3 en fa mayor, RV. 293)

Primer movimiento: Allegro
Los alegres campesinos celebran con danzas y cantos la recolección de la cosecha; musicalmente, la danza está escrita en un compás de 4/4, en donde las figuras rítmicas son iguales tanto para el solista como para toda la orquesta; el cambio rítmico del solista en arpegios de dobles corcheas describe a un borrachín que, después de varias travesuras, al fin se queda dormido.

Segundo movimiento: Adagio molto
Los demás campesinos no dejan solo a este borrachín y lo acompañan en su embriaguez hasta que el vino y el sueño los vence.

Tercer movimiento: Allegro
Llenos de gran entusiasmo y acompañados por los ladridos de sus perros y el sonar de sus cornos, los cazadores se dirigen al bosque.

Antonio Lucio Vivaldi (Venecia, 4 de marzo de 1678 - Viena, 28 de julio de 1741), fue un compositor y músico del Barroco tardío. Se trata de una de las figuras más relevantes de la historia de la música. Su maestría se refleja en haber cimentado el género del concierto, el más importante de su época. Vivió los años de transición del siglo XVII al siglo XVIII, es decir, el final del llamado periodo barroco de la música. 

En ese momento el legado histórico de la música europea era trascendental, pues había emergido de las primitivas formas del Medievo a la ejecución de varias melodías al mismo tiempo en la polifonía, estilo que diferenciaría a la música occidental de la del resto del mundo. Este género musical se desarrolló tanto en el ámbito religioso como en el profano.

En la música, el primer paso para encontrar elementos contrastantes consistió en separar la música en tres diferentes episodios, dotados cada uno de velocidad y ritmo diferentes; rápido-lento-rápido, secuencia característica de la sonata da camera, o de la sonata da chiesa, cuando el primer movimiento de ésta tenía un carácter lento o grave.

Otra forma de lograr el contraste fue la de tocar un tema en su primera aparición dentro de una dinámica fuerte y luego repetir el mismo ahora de forma suave como un eco. Este efecto también se lograría utilizando el recurso de la acumulación de instrumentos, separando dentro de la orquesta de cámara a un pequeño grupo instrumental (concertino) del resto de la orquesta (ripieno o tutti), interviniendo primero toda la orquesta y luego solamente el concertino, logrando así el efecto sonoro contrastante. 

En consecuencia, se originaba la forma musical conocida como concerto grosso, que a su vez originaría la forma conocida simplemente como concierto, en donde el solista demuestra sus habilidades técnicas, enfrentando con su instrumento a toda la masa orquestal.

En el concierto barroco son marcados los contrastes: en tempo (velocidad), la exposición temática en forma de eco y la lograda por la oposición de un instrumento en contra de toda una orquesta.

Este reciente estilo musical tendría que adherirse a uno de los conceptos de la estética aristotélica que dominaba en la época; la imitación de la naturaleza.

Antonio Vivaldi escribió cerca de 500 conciertos para diversos instrumentos, 220 de ellos dedicados al violín, instrumento del cual Antonio era un virtuoso.

Cuatro de estos conciertos, pertenecientes a Il cimento dell´armonia e dell´invenzione y reunidos en el Op. 8 (1725) escritos para violín solista, orquesta de cuerdas y clavecín, son los que se conocen con el nombre de Las cuatro estaciones.

En estos cuatro conciertos se encuentran ejemplificadas todas las características anteriormente descritas del concierto barroco. Se trata de obras musicales únicamente para ser escuchadas; bien definidos los contrastes de tiempo, pues cada concierto está dividido en tres partes: tempo rápido-lento-rápido; el elemento dinámico contrastante está cubierto por el efecto del eco; se tiene a un virtuoso solista que, acompañado solamente por el ''basso'' continuo, enfrenta a toda la orquesta y, por último, se cumple con la justificación artística de imitación de la naturaleza, buen pretexto para escribir una obra maestra.

videosDetails.title: Let's Go Pocoyo! - Pocoyo's band (S03E01)
videosDetails.description:
"Let's Go Pocoyó" es una nueva serie de animación para niños de 3 a 6 años con un giro especial: que sea un primer acercamiento a una segunda lengua a través del aprendizaje de un vocabulario básico y sencillo. Una forma amena de aprender, siguiendo las divertidas aventuras de Pocoyó y sus inseparables amigos. 

Los episodios tienen una historia central sencilla en las que Pocoyó y sus amigos viven su aventura aprendiendo siempre algo al final. Valores como la amistad, el respeto o el compañerismo.

Con la participación y colaboración del British Council.

Suscríbete al canal de Pocoyó en YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/pocoyotv

Lista de reproducción de Let's Go Pocoyo!: http://goo.gl/Ynm2BS

¡Diviértete con Pocoyó! 

WEB: http://www.pocoyo.com
APPS: http://www.pocoyo.com/apps
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/pocoyo
GOOGLE+: http://gplus.to/pocoyo
AMAZON: http://www.amazon.es/pocoyo
TIENDA OFICIAL: http://pocoyofficialstore.com

Pocoyó es un niño pequeño, espontáneo y muy curioso, que está descubriendo el mundo. Todo lo que hay en la vida de Pocoyó es nuevo, emocionante y sobre todo divertido. En sus aventuras le acompañan sus inseparables amigos Pato, Elly, Pajaroto, su mascota Loula entre muchos otros.

videosDetails.title: The Solar System Song
videosDetails.description:
It's a song about the Sun and the planets for children of all ages.
This song was written and performed by A.J. Jenkins. Video by KidsTV123
Copyright 2011 A.J. Jenkins/KidsTV123: All rights reserved.
For free MP3s, worksheets and much more:
http://www.kidstv123.com

Kids songs song for children

Chords - Capo 2nd Fret
C Em F C G F
(Final Chorus - Em F)

I am the Sun. I'm a burning ball of fire. I'm very big indeed.
Life on earth depends on me. I am the Sun.

I am Mercury. I'm the closest planet to the Sun. 
I'm a ball of iron -- I have no moons. I am Mercury.

I am Venus. I'm the same size as the Earth but I spin the other way and much more slowly.
I have no water -- I am Venus.

I am the Earth. The place where we all live. There is land and lots of sea so I look blue.
I have a moon. I am the Earth.

I am Mars. I'm a rocky, red planet. My mountains are the highest in our solar system.
I have 2 moons. I am Mars.

I am Jupiter. I'm a gas giant. I'm the biggest and I spin the fastest. I have the biggest moon. I am Jupiter. 

I am Saturn. I'm a gas giant. My rings are made of ice. Titan is my biggest moon. I am Saturn.

I am Uranus. I'm an icy gas giant. I'm the coldest planet in our solar system. And I have rings made of dust. I am Uranus.

I am Neptune. I'm an icy gas giant. I'm the farthest planet from the sun. I have many storms. I am Neptune.

We are The Solar System.

Glub glub. 
ROAR!

LEARN FOR KIDS - WARM COLD | This & That | Opposites Nursery Rhymes

In this episode of the This & That YouTube series, This and That sing about the opposites warm/cold.

The song lyrics you can find below. 
For more fun... check also the karaoke version of this song in our karaoke playlist!

----------

ABOUT 

This and That are two friends who sing songs about the opposites we find in daily life. 
The characters each represent one of a pair opposites. They're different, but belong together.

Join in, have fun, and subscribe to our channel to stay up-to-date!

This & That is an animated youtube series made for children from 1 till 4 years old and is a production of Learn Like a Lion.

----------

FREE COLORING PAGE

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B3exp3AZMQczTXotUkMxWWVqZDg

----------

SOCIAL MEDIA

learnlikealion@gmail.com

https://nl.pinterest.com/learnlikealion

Thanks for watching and don't forget to subscribe for more coming This & That animation videos!

----------

LYRICS WARM / COLD

It's sunny in the summer
Warm warm warm
I'm playing in the sun with the cows on the farm

It's warm the sun is shining
Shining on our skins
We're happy when summer begins

It's snowing in the winter 
Cold cold cold
Two big and round snowballs, yes that is what I've rolled

It's cold the snow is falling
Come outside if you can
Let's make from snowballs a snowman

Warm, cold, warm, cold
We sing about the weather
I like this, and I like that
Why don't we sing together

One step. Two steps. Three steps forward.

videosDetails.description:
LEARN FOR KIDS - WARM COLD | This & That | Opposites Nursery Rhymes

In this episode of the This & That YouTube series, This and That sing about the opposites warm/cold.

The song lyrics you can find below. 
For more fun... check also the karaoke version of this song in our karaoke playlist!

----------

ABOUT 

This and That are two friends who sing songs about the opposites we find in daily life. 
The characters each represent one of a pair opposites. They're different, but belong together.

Join in, have fun, and subscribe to our channel to stay up-to-date!

This & That is an animated youtube series made for children from 1 till 4 years old and is a production of Learn Like a Lion.

LEARN FOR KIDS - WARM COLD | This & That | Opposites Nursery Rhymes

In this episode of the This & That YouTube series, This and That sing about the opposites warm/cold.

The song lyrics you can find below. 
For more fun... check also the karaoke version of this song in our karaoke playlist!

----------

ABOUT 

This and That are two friends who sing songs about the opposites we find in daily life. 
The characters each represent one of a pair opposites. They're different, but belong together.

Join in, have fun, and subscribe to our channel to stay up-to-date!

This & That is an animated youtube series made for children from 1 till 4 years old and is a production of Learn Like a Lion.

videosDetails.title: job song - nursery rhymes for kids
videosDetails.description:
Job song is a lovely song that teaches kids about the work people do. It is an interesting song that tells kids about a tailor, a cobbler, a barber, a carpenter, a policeman and a postman. Kids would love to sing and role play on this song. Here are the lyrics:

I am a tailor stitching clothes
Stitch, stitch, stitch my needle goes.

I am a cobbler mending shoes
Rat, tat, tat and it’s just like new.

I am a barber cutting hair,
Snap, snap, snap my scissors work on your hair.

I am a policeman, I stand so,
Telling the cars to stop and go.

I am a carpenter making furniture,
Bang, bang, bang goes my hammer.

I am a postman, I come home
Bringing letters and parcels too.

Knock, knock - this one is for you.
Knock, knock - this one is for you.

Hope you like our song. Subscribe to our channel to watch more of such songs - http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=turtleinteractive
